Notes: We would lose flag, which is reported in all other data sets
Highest spatio-temporal resolution that still retains flag
I am 50/50 on using this one, but the main allure is that it matches temporal resolution of PS data from WCPFC. Their metadata also say they report a bit more than the annual.

Alternatively, we can use this one because we get as much data as possible (there is less data loss due to privacy concerns), we don't lose any spatial resolution, and we don't lose any flag info. However, it would be the only raw annual data set. Their metadata also says they report slighlty less than the quarterly.
The metadata says they reporte more than 100% of effort, which I find weird.
Data are aggregated "preferably to monthly", but might not be reported as such. PS effort data is mostly reported in fishing days, even though the say sets is a better measure.

There is just one data set. Sometimes month is not reported, but they will report the year or the quarter. The spatial resolution also varies, although it follows the patterns we've observed for PS and LL (1 and 5, respectively).
In the same file as PS
